title: Friendship Relation
problem_statement:
Friendship Relation

There are N students in the college. We have M friendship relations between pairs of students (i.e., for pair (u, v), u and v are said to be friends with each other).

The friendship relation is transitive, meaning that if pairs (a, b) and (b, c) exist, then we can assume that (a, c) also exists.

You need to find the minimum number of additional friendship relations that need to be added so that all N students will be friends with each other.

Function Description

Complete the solve() function. The function takes the following 2 parameters and returns an integer denoting the answer to the question:

  • N: Represents the number of elements in the array
  • Friends: Represents a list of M pairs - denoting the friendship relations

Input Format

Note: Use this input format if you are testing against custom input or writing code in a language where we don\'t provide boilerplate code.

  • The first line contains a single integer N denoting the number of elements in the array.
  • The second line contains a single integer M denoting the number of friendship relations.
  • Each of the next M lines contains two space-separated integers, u and v, denoting the friendship relation between u and v.

It is guaranteed that u ≠ v and a relation pair (u, v) occurs not more than once in the input.

Output Format

Print an integer answer to the question.

Constraints

  • 1 ≤ N ≤ 2 * 105
  • 1 ≤ u, v ≤ N
  • 0 ≤ M ≤ min(3 * 106, N * (N - 1)/2)

Sample Test Case

4
3
1 2
